intro: Chelonopsis odontochila subsp. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate chelonopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers clustered in umbels. The subspecies is distinguished by the presence of bracts, which are modified leaves that enclose the flower clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. This plant is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
